title: How to pay someone's cell phone bill on my cell phone - Quora

response.answer_text: Absolutely. It’s possible. Depending on the other persons carrier, the steps may vary. You may or may not need personal information or their password. Most POSTPAID (contract) bills can be done at a carrier store with a minimal amount of knowledge. You walk in, tell a person “I’d like to put this amount of money on the account with this telephone number” and they will almost always take it. If you don’t know the persons carrier or its prepaid, it’s a little harder, but can be done if you’re communicating with them. Now, it is hard to ANONYMOUSLY pay someone’s bill, especially if it’s prepaid. You would not have the minimum amount of information required to direct your payment to the proper end, but not fully impossible, if you can determine at the least, which provider or carrier it is.

Easiest answer is to call the carrier and tell them what you want to do. They will take your credit card number and credit the other person’s account. Slightly harder, but still doable is you get the carrier application that lets you pay bills and enter all the right stuff. This requires you have intimate knowledge of the other person’s phone arrangements. You will need their password and possibly a PIN code. If they don’t want to give this information to you, you are back to the first technique. Me? I wouldn’t even ask about the second way. Just do it by calling.

Most cell phone companies offer a direct-pay contact number - usually one only needs a cell-number and credit card in order to pay someone’s Bill. With at&t we offer pay-stations in our COR stores. All that’s required is the number in question and amount you desire to pay - both cash and credit cards are accepted.

response.answer_text: So using the web browser on your phone, go to the website of the Operator and search Payment of Bills / Recharge. There enter the number of the person you would like to pay for and follow the on screen instructions including your bank / Card PIN etc.
